item.title: Keynote and Session Videos and Slides
item.description:
All of the available keynote and session videos and slides have now been added to the website.

The videos can also be viewed directly on our DrupalCamp Toronto account on Vimeo. Feel free to embed the videos on your websites and share them.

All videos are released under a Creative Commons license.

We've turned on Vimeo's Tip This Video feature for all of the videos. All proceeds from "tips" will go directly towards DrupalCamp Toronto 2013.

Thank you to all who presented informative and thought provoking keynotes and sessions at DrupalCamp Toronto 2012. Your sharing of knowledge and ideas is the fuel that keeps Drupal progressing and moving forward!
item.dc:creator: drupal

item.title: Top Ten Reasons to Attend DrupalCamp Toronto 2012
item.description:
DrupalCamp Toronto 2012 is shaping up to an amazing event for Drupal enthusiasts. Here are ten reasons why you won't want to miss it!

10. It's Inexpensive!

Similar conferences of this scale in Toronto are expensive - in the range of $500 and higher. DrupalCamp Toronto 2012 costs a low $65 for the entire two-day event! Considering the huge variety of sessions, great keynotes and community interaction, DrupalCamp is a huge bargain! We also have student discounts!

9. Networking

DrupalCamp is a great event to connect with developers, employers and other Drupal enthusiasts. You'll have countless opportunities to connect during the event and at our opening night party.

8. Keynote by Jeff Eaton

Jeff Eaton is widely know as one of the most engaging and entertaining speakers in the Drupal community. If you've ever learned about platypodes, bets are that you can thank Jeff.

7. Birds of a Feather

What is a DrupalCamp without the BoF sessions? BoFs are a chance for you to create your own informal sessions on topics not covered in our main program of sessions. Share your knowledge and/or questions informally with fellow Drupal enthusiasts!

6. 25+ Sessions

The heart of DrupalCamp Toronto 2012 is the 25+ sessions we're hosting on Friday and Saturday. We'll have a range of sessions for beginner, intermediate and advanced skill levels covering tracks for development, design and business.

5. Great Prizes!

We have some great prizes for attendees to win! Attendees have a chance to win a 1-year Drupalize.me membership (a $420 value), a 1-year premium Lynda.com subscription (a $450 value) and DrupalCamp travel mugs!

4. Keynote by James Walker

James Walker has worked with Drupal for a very long time. His reputation as a proponent of open source technologies, being a skilled educator and community leadership are well earned. Trivia: James actually helped organize the first DrupalCamp events in Toronto!

3. Great Sponsors

DrupalCamp Toronto 2012 wouldn't be possible without the generous support of our amazing sponsors! Thank you to Peapod Studios, Myplanet Digital, Freeform Solutions, Digital Echidna, Nextide, 2bits.com, Evolving Web, JMA Consulting, Lullabot, K2 Digital, Discovery Garden and Verge Interactive for their sponsorship of this year's event.

2. Keynote by Angela Byron

Angela Byron is the core co-maintainer of Drupal 7, an award winning developer and author. She lives and breathes Drupal like few others. Angela was the first woman to be featured on the cover of Linux Journal, in April 2011.

1. The Community

Drupal's best strength is its community. The opportunities to meet up with fellow DrupalCamp attendees is invaluable. Whether it's impromptu conversations between sessions, Birds of a Feather sessions, mingling at the opening night party or elsewhere, you'll quickly learn why the Drupal community rocks!

So there you have it! Head over to the registration page and sign-up for DrupalCamp Toronto 2012!
item.dc:creator: Chris Luckhardt

item.title: Likes and Retweets are Votes Too!
item.description:
Update: Voting has ended! Thanks to everyone for your website votes, retweets and likes! Watch for an updated session schedule tomorrow!

You know we're on Twitter and Facebook, right? We're posting quick updates to both about DrupalCamp Toronto 2012, so check them out if you haven't already done so!

If you look at each of the proposed sessions, you will see Tweet and Like buttons below their titles. Each tweet, retweet and like will also being counted towards voting until 5pm on Monday!

So stay tuned to our Twitter account and Facebook page tonight and tomorrow until 5pm to help boost the votes for your favourite sessions!
item.dc:creator: Chris Luckhardt

item.title: Start Voting!
item.description:
Update: Voting has ended! Thanks to everyone for your website votes, retweets and likes! Watch for an updated session schedule tomorrow!

Session voting is now open to registered users! Look for the big, green "Vote For This Session! :)" button on each session page!

Here's a quick list of the proposed sessions to get you started. The sessions are divided into the categories chosen by their presenters.

Note: you must be registered and logged in to vote!

Beginner

  • Building Communities using Organic Groups
  • Work Flow for Solo Developers and Small Teams
  • User Experience Design
  • Drupal from an Outsider's Perspective
  • 101 Exciting Tips to Get the Site You Need While Saving Time and Money (and Get That Promotion You Deserve in the Process)
  • Views: An Introduction
  • Being Mobile: Strategies for Successful Mobile Sites
  • Panel Discussion: The Drupal Apocalypse!
  • Managing Media with the Media and File Entity Modules

Intermediate

  • HUGE? How to Deal with 381 Modules, 174GB Database and 200 Million Row Tables
  • Composer Package Management: When Our Powers Combine...
  • A Responsive Design Case Study - What We Did Wrong Building ResponsiveDesign.ca (and How We Fixed It)
  • Aegir-Based Business Models
  • Evaluating Base Themes
  • Drupal for Mesh Networks (Community Networks)
  • Views Configuration: Taking it to the Next Level
  • Going Mobile
  • Coding For Config: Install Profile Development Using Features
  • You Already Know How to Develop a Native Mobile App
  • University of Waterloo - Managing 150 Sites Using One Install Profile
  • Why You Want a Frontend Framework for Better Development
  • How Drupal Architecture Affects the Drupal Community: a Case Study with Two Other CMSs
  • CMS 2.0: Are We There Yet?
  • Drupal with SMS and Telephony for Fun and Profit
  • Drupal as a RESTful Backend for Client Side Applications
  • Open Advocacy - Citizens Connected Goes Open Source
  • Snatching Usability from the Jaws of Drupal

Advanced

  • Fearless Development with Drush, Vagrant and Aegir
  • Vagrant for Drupal
item.dc:creator: Chris Luckhardt

item.title: Get Ready to Vote for Your Favourite Sessions!
item.description:
We've had dozens of session submissions in the past couple of weeks! Thanks to everyone in the community who has submitted a session.

A range of beginner, intermediate and advanced have been proposed by the community; an exciting program is coming together for DrupalCamp Toronto 2012!

Voting will open later today, so check out the current list of session proposals and get your voting mojo ready!

Session submissions will close once voting begins, so if you're still on the fence about submitting a session, get in contact with us and we can help you out. We're still open to having more beginner session proposals, so if you have a great idea for new Drupal users, let us know!
item.dc:creator: Chris Luckhardt

item.title: DrupalCamp Loves Peapod Studios!
item.description:
Thanks to Peapod Studios (a platinum sponsor) for donating several new graphic elements to DrupalCamp Toronto 2012. Our original volunteer designer left the project early and our friends at Peapod Studios stepped up to complete the job with all new banners, images, logos and social media elements for our website, Facebook, Twitter, T-shirts, swag bags and signs. Their work is not only visually beautiful, but it was also delivered with lightning speed.

Check out Peapod Studios' blog post "Peapod Loves DrupalCamp Toronto" on their escapepod blog.

Read more about Peapod Studios on our dedicated platinum sponsor page.
item.dc:creator: Chris Luckhardt

item.title: Submit a Session!
item.description:
DrupalCamp is fast approaching and we're ready to accept session submissions from the community!

Do you have a great idea for a session? Do you have some Drupal knowledge to share with your fellow Drupal enthusiasts? Then head on over to our session submission page to submit a session.

Note: you must be signed in to submit a session!

We've already received some session proposals, which can be viewed on the Proposed Sessions page. New sessions will be added daily, so check back often to see what's being proposed by the community.

Past sessions have included:

  • An Introduction to Drupal
  • Multilingual Site Buiding With Drupal 7
  • Site Performance, Optimization & Scalability
  • How Drupal Enables Designers
  • Education & Community Site Case Studies
  • Agile Practices for Drupal
  • Winning in the Enterprise With Drupal
  • Responsive Design and Drupal Theming
  • Pixel Perfect: Drupal Slideshows and Photo Galleries
  • Drupal SEO

...and many more!
item.dc:creator: Chris Luckhardt

item.title: Get Ready for DrupalCamp Toronto 2012!
item.description:
Welcome to the new DrupalCamp Toronto 2012 website!

Your organizing team has been hard at work over the past few weeks in preparation for hosting our annual DrupalCamp Toronto event. This year's camp is happening on November 16th & 17th at The Burroughes Building, a beautifully renovated space, at the corner of Queen and Bathurst.

DrupalCamp Toronto 2012 promises to be an exciting event, with great sessions for designers and developers, individuals and businesses, and beginner to expert level Drupal users.

Our keynote speakers for this year's event are Angie Byron and James Walker!

This year's core organizing team from the Toronto Drupal User Group includes:

  • Chris Luckhardt (@motionblur)
  • Steph Brown (@vicearoni)
  • Tyler Struyk (@iStryker)
  • Emad Al-Shihabi (@emadshi)
  • Teresa Chin (@teresajchin)
  • Cleaver Barnes (@cleaverbarnes)
  • Aidan Foster (@finteractive)

The full list of community members who are assisting with this year's DrupalCamp will be announced soon!

Registration will open up in the next few days! You'll also be able to submit your session proposals soon too! Watch for registration and session submission announcements here or via our Twitter (hashtag: #dcto2012) and Facebook social media channels.
item.dc:creator: Chris Luckhardt
